name: muckraker
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person, especially one in a news organization, who tries to find out unpleasant information about people or organizations in order to make it public: He made a name for himself as a celebrity muckraker in this relatively quiet little city. Muckrakers aren't likely to dredge secrets from his past. See
muckraking
More examplesFewer examplesHe's a professional muckraker who makes a decent living going through rubbish.She has a reputation as one of journalism's most thorough muckrakers.An opportunistic muckraker may have come across the document illicitly.
